name: sour gas, burned in gas turbine | sour gas, burned in gas turbine | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6174/documentation

Burning of sour gas in a turbine for on-site electricity production.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



Providing of compression energy by the exploitation of (sour) gas fields.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Average of 1999-2000 is used for CH4, CO2, NMVOC, NO2 (data from the Norwegian offshore combined production). Data for CO, N2O, SO2, Hg, Radon-222 and waste heat are based on data from 1991 in Frischknecht et al. 1996, Tab. V.6.7.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data for CH4, CO2, NMVOC, NO2 is based on Norwegian data, data for the rest is not geographically defined.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Data is based on the Norwegian data (offshore combined production). No information about technology. As the data is an average over all gas turbines, motors and boilers in the Norwegian gas and oil production it can be assumed that different technologies are represented.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Norwegian data can be extrapolated for global exploitation turbines
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Data is based on the annual reports on emissions and discharges submitted by each individual operator. The emissions and discharges are estimated
according to guidelines given by the Norwegian authorities and OLF (Norwegian Oil Industry Association)
